ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] active threads
ygData.msgSnippet: Because of the crawler s adjustable politeness settings, with respect to any one given remote server, it will typically spend more time waiting between fetches

Because of the crawler's adjustable politeness settings, with respect to any
one given remote server, it will typically spend more time waiting between
fetches than it does in fetches/processing.

Thus even if there are 50 target sites, no more than a few threads may ever
be necessary at once, because 90%+ of the target sites are in politeness-
waiting at all times.

- Gordon @ IA

robeger wrote:

> I've got a crawl running with 21 seed URIs, and the max toe threads is
> set to 50.  I've never seen a higher number than "4 of 50" in the
> active threads value on the console page.  Am I not understanding
> something, or do I maybe have something set incorrectly?  I guess I
> was expecting that  I'd see more active threads (21? since there were
> 21 hosts being crawled?)
> 
> Thanks,
